description.value:
As a demigod, it's easy for you to align to the cause of a champion or perfect your favored weapon. You gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.0YjetnLVIUz9zQt5]{Champion Dedication} (as a champion of yourself) or a dedication for an archetype directly matching your favored weapon (for instance, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.vx5FGEG34AxI2dow.JournalEntryPage.o71hqcfzhCKXcSml] matches for a bow favored weapon, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.vx5FGEG34AxI2dow.JournalEntryPage.RoF5NOFBefXAPftS] matches for a two-handed favored weapon, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.vx5FGEG34AxI2dow.JournalEntryPage.O9P1YgtiCgHlPNp5] doesn't match for a scimitar even though it has a feat involving scimitars since it isn't the main focus of the archetype). If you choose Champion Dedication, you don't need to meet the attribute modifier prerequisites.

Special With the GM's permission, you can also choose @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.qvWmW5JWpVBDyGqe]{Exemplar Dedication} with this feat, using your own divine spark, though in that case the feat is rare. This is a very thematic choice, but there are mechanical reasons the GM might not allow it even though they allowed a demigod character, so you might want to talk to your GM first about Exemplar Dedication in case they have any changes to it in their game.
